meanings.definition: A person or group that is a chief rival of another.
meanings.sent1: In the basketball tournament, our team faced our archrival in the final match.
meanings.sent2: The two companies have been archrivals in the market for years.
meanings.sent3: The archrival team's mascot always tries to outshine ours with funny dances.
meanings.sent4: The archrival's success serves as a constant motivation for our team to improve.
meanings.sent5: The intense competition between the archrival schools made the championship game thrilling.

meanings.definition: To be a chief rival of another.
meanings.sent1: Our team will archrival against the reigning champions in the upcoming match.
meanings.sent2: She always seems to archrival her best friend in every competition they enter.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully archrival each other in video games to see who is better.
meanings.sent4: The two companies constantly archrival for the top spot in the industry.
meanings.sent5: His determination to archrival his opponent was evident in his focused expression during the race.
